learning_outcomes.description: read and analyse the reading passages in the LATN1110 Reader

demonstrate via exercises, quizzes, reading and parsing an understanding of the morphology, syntax and vocabulary of Latin up to Section 2C contained in the Grammar Reader put together for LATN1110, and the Latin reading passages in Reading Latin Text up to 2C.

assessments.due_date:
9/04/2025 10:00 am

The mid-semester exam will be held in class in person.
assessments.task_description:
MID-SEMESTER EXAM

Length: 50 mins

Content and Requirements:

  • translation from Latin into English of passages from the Introduction to Section 1E of the LATN1110 Text Reader. English translations must demonstrate your understanding of the Latin
  • parsing to show your understanding of the vocabulary, grammar, and syntax contained in the texts translated weekly in class, so it is important that you do your weekly translations and come to class to discuss your translations and ask questions
  • translation into English of sentences/passages based on the learning vocabulary, grammar, and syntax of the Introduction to Section 1E. English translations must demonstrate your understanding of the Latin
  • grammatical questions/exercises of the type covered in class and for assignments based on the Introduction- 1E, designed to test your increasing knowledge of the vocabulary, grammar, and syntax covered in these sections.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course
assessments.submission_guidelines: Examination paper, answer paper and working paper will be provided at the start of the exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: In Person exam: scheduled by UQ Examinations
assessments.task_description:
Length: 2 Hours

Content and Requirements:

  • translation from Latin into English of passages from the Section 1F-Section 2C of the LATN1110 Text Reader. English translations must demonstrate your understanding of the Latin
  • parsing to show your understanding of the vocabulary, grammar and syntax contained in the texts translated weekly in class (Introduction-Section 2C), so it is important that you do your weekly translations and come to class to discuss your translations and ask questions
  • translation into English of sentences/passages based on the learning vocabulary, grammar and syntax of (Introduction-Section 2C). English translations must demonstrate your understanding of the Latin
  • grammatical questions/exercises of the type covered in class and for assignments based on the (Introduction-Section 2C), designed to test your increasing knowledge of the vocabulary, grammar, and syntax covered in these sections.


.This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.

assessments.assessment_title: Skill Building: Vocab, Grammar and Accidence
assessments.task_description:
QUIZZES 15%

EITHER 1083 or more uqlatin quizzes (located on UQ Extend) completed throughout semester or 2 timed Blackboard quizzes held in conjunction with the mid-semester and final exam


uqlatin quizzes:

Students must complete 3 genuine attempts at all the following types of quizzes on uqlatin, with their overall number of quizzes attempted equaling 1083 (there are 361 quizzes in total):

  • noun declension
  • adjective/pronoun declension
  • verb conjugation
  • word matching/vocab translation
  • translation/identification of prepositions and idiomatic constructions

If you elect to take this option, you must start your quiz practice in Week 1 or you will not reach the required number of quizzes by the end of semester.


STUDENTS WHO DO NOT TAKE UP THIS OPTION MUST COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING

Two (2) timed Blackboard Quizzes held in conjunction with the mid-semester and final exams

Each quiz is 10 mins long, and only one attempt is permitted for each quiz. The mark for each quiz will be added together and divided by 2 to calculate the final mark out of 15.

  • noun declension
  • adjective/pronoun declension
  • verb conjugation
  • word matching/vocab translation
  • translation/identification of prepositions and idiomatic constructions


Details of both assessment tasks are available on Blackboard


These assessment tasks evaluate students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Skill Building: Translation, Parsing and Grammar
assessments.due_date: Online via Turnitin on Blackboard by 14:00 (2pm) on the dates specified on Blackboard.
assessments.task_description:
Students are required to complete six (6) take home assignments and submit them on Blackboard by the dates and times specified. The due dates are available under the assessment tab on the LATN1110 Blackboard site, and on the course Learning Map. Please note that ALL 6 assignments must be submitted to achieve a passing grade for this course.


Assignments comprise:

  • translation from Latin into English of sentences and passages based on the learning vocabulary and grammar studied in the week(s) preceding each assignment. Translations must demonstrate your understanding of the Latin
  • parsing of words to show your understanding of the text (vocabulary, grammar, and syntax)
  • translation into Latin of some simple sentences and/or a short unseen passage based on the learning vocabulary. Translations must demonstrate your understanding of the Latin.
  • grammatical exercises of the type covered in class.

Assignments are designed to test your increasing knowledge of the vocabulary, grammar, and syntax covered during the course

It is important to read the feedback you receive each week, reflect on what you need to work on, and ask questions if you are still unsure.


This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. This includes the use of programs such as Google Translate, which are usually inaccurate.

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please submit on Blackboard following the instructions provided
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
(Week 1) 24 Feb- 2 March: Course Introduction, Methods of Studying Latin, Basic Grammatical Concepts

Introduction; methods of studying Latin; basic grammatical concepts and terminology; pronunciation of classical Latin


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_title: (Week 1) 24 Feb- 2 March: Course Introduction, Methods of Studying Latin, Basic Grammatical Concepts
learning_activities.topic_description: (Week 1) 24 Feb- 2 March:  Course Introduction, Methods of Studying Latin, Basic Grammatical Concepts Introduction; methods of studying Latin; basic grammatical concepts and terminology; pronunciation of classical Latin

learning_activities.topic:
(Week 2): Section 1A

Please prepare for both classes the text of Section 1A from the LATN1110 Text Reader. Requirements will be explained in Week 1 of the course.

Don't worry if you can't get through the whole text- your skills will increase rapidly during the course.

In class, we will learn about grammatical concepts by doing class exercises and re-translating the text together to reinforce these concepts and build vocabulary and reading skills.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
